Discord.Each target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target bickers and argues with other creatures for 1 minute. During this time, it is incapable of meaningful communication and has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

Fear. Each target must make a Wisdom saving throw and becomes {@condition frightened} for 1 minute on a failed save. While {@condition frightened}, the target drops whatever it is holding and must move at least 30 feet away from the glyph on each of its turns, if able.

Hopelessness.Each target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target is overwhelmed with despair for 1 minute. During this time, it can't attack or target any creature with harmful abilities, spells, or other magical effects.

Insanity.Each target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target is driven insane for 1 minute. An insane creature can't take actions, can't understand what other creatures say, can't read, and speaks only in gibberish. The DM controls its movement, which is erratic.
Pain.Each target must make a Constitution saving throw and becomes {@condition incapacitated} with excruciating pain for 1 minute on a failed save.

Sleep.Each target must make a Wisdom saving throw and falls {@condition unconscious} for 10 minutes on a failed save. A creature awakens if it takes damage or if someone uses an action to shake or slap it awake.
Stunning.Each target must make a Wisdom saving throw and becomes {@condition stunned} for 1 minute on a failed save.

Spell Loss.Each target must make a Wisdom saving throw or lose their highest level spell slot. All creatures with spell slots must continue making this save each turn until they have no more spell slots, or until the symbol has absorbed 50 levels of spells.

m.text: mercury, phosphorus, and powdered diamond and opal with a total value of at least 1,000 gp, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Temportation
entries: This spell transports you and up to eight willing creatures of your choice within range to a time period that you select. If you target an object, it must be able to fit entirely inside a 10-foot cube, and it can't be held or carried by an unwilling creature. You must have an object from the destination time period to cast this spell.

When you arrive, you appear in the same place as you currently are. Time travelers cause immediate, local damage to the timeline, and they can't move or take actions for 1 minute after arriving as the timeline attempts to repair itself. Even after the immediate effects subside, each time traveler's world-line is at risk of fraying from traveling too far into the past or future. For every 100 years traveled, the subjects of this spell take a level of {@condition exhaustion}.
If you attempt to cast this spell within an area of blind time, you disappear permanently and only magic of 10th level or higher can bring you back.
If you cast this spell on a timeless plane, such as the astral plane, it has no effect.

components.m: An object that was present during the time period you are traveling to.

spell.name: Mordenkainen's Capable Caravel
entries: You conjure into existence a fine, seaworthy ship to carry you and your companions safely and comfortably.

A normal caravel is a fairly small, two-decked sailing ship. It holds a generous amount of cargo and offers cramped quarters for crew and passengers. The ship produced by this spell has even more room for cargo and passengers, contained within an extradimensional hold accessed through a hatch on the aft upper deck.

Lifting the hatch reveals a set of wooden stairs, which descend about 6 feet to a horizontal shimmering in the air about 4 feet wide. Only those you designate can enter this space, and the extradimensional portal is shut and made {@condition invisible} behind you when you enter. Those without authorization to enter instead continue descending the steps to an ordinary cargo hold. You can open the portal again from your own side at will.

Those who pass beyond the portal's entrance find themselves in a magnificent foyer with many staterooms whose doors open from this space. The atmosphere is clean, fresh, and warm. You can create any deck plan you desire within the limit of the spell's effect.

The cabins are furnished, and the galley contains sufficient foodstuffs and preparation equipment to serve three full meals per day per person per caster level. A staff of near-transparent pursers (up to two per caster level), liveried and obedient, wait upon all who enter. They function as {@spell unseen servant} spells except that they are visible and can go anywhere within the extradimensional space.
Since the place can be entered only through its special portal, outside conditions do not affect the passenger space, nor do conditions inside it pass to the plane beyond.

The ship is crewed by a minimum complement of spectral deckhands, which perform the basic tasks of maintenance. These, like the cabin servants, behave as {@spell unseen servants} but can travel anywhere on board ship and can enter the extradimensional space if you so direct. The spectral deckhands respond to the direction of the helmsman, reducing the number of crew necessary to control the caravel to 1. If you do not provide a real helmsman, the ship will steer itself on the last course a living helmsman provided but will not be able to avoid collisions or hazards or adjust to changing conditions.

Bad weather or other marine hazards can still threaten the vessel, but even if it sinks, the passenger space remains safe and isolated (though exiting it might prove difficult). The vessel is not armed, and has no special protections beyond its extradimensional hold. Spectral deckhands, like {@spell unseen servants}, can't attack. If a spectral deckhand is destroyed, the ship can create a new one each round.

m.text: A miniature ship carved from mahogany, rigged with silk sails and gold thread, with a total value of at least 500 gp.

spell.name: Crushing Fist of Spite
entries: A fist of darkness appears 30 feet above the ground and begins smashing down with incredible power.
All creatures and objects in a 5-foot-radius cylinder that is 30 feet high take {@dice 8d6} points of force damage, or half that on a successful Dexterity saving throw.
Each round, as a bonus action, you can direct the fist to another area within range, where it smashes downward again.
It continues to attack the same area unless otherwise directed. The fist does not need to strike the ground.
It can attack airborne targets as well. Airborne targets that succeed on the Dexterity save take no damage and are forcibly ejected from the spell's area.

components.m: The severed hand of a priest of a good-aligned deity

spell.name: Glorious Transmutation
entries: At the conclusion of an 8 hour ritual, you lay your hands upon a volume of base metal, and transmute it into a precious metal. You must concentrate during the entire casting of this spell. If you {@status concentration} is broken, then the volume of metal rusts away and you must make a Constitution saving throw against your own spell save DC or become Petrified.

This spell transmutes iron into an equal volume of silver, or lead into an equal volume of gold. This spell will not transmute alloys of any sort; the metal to be transmuted must be pure. At the DMâ€™s discretion, the spell might transmute other types of metals as well.
This spell can transmute up to 5 cubic feet of metal.
5 cubic feet of lead weighs approximately 3,500 pounds and costs 175 gp. Transmuting this into gold will increase the weight to approximately 6,000 pounds, with a value of approximately 300,000 gp.

5 cubic feet of iron weighs approximately 2,500 pounds and costs 250 gp. Transmuting this into silver will increase the weight to approximately 3,250 pounds, weight a value of approximately 30,000 gp.

m.text: A philosopher's stone

spell.name: Greater Tenser's Transformation
entries: You endow yourself with endurance and martial prowess fueled by magic. Until the spell ends, you can't cast spells, and you gain the following benefits:

• You gain 100 temporary hit points. If any of these remain when the spell ends, they are lost.
  • You have advantage on attack rolls that you make with simple and martial weapons.
  • When you hit a target with a weapon attack, that target takes an extra {@damage 4d12} force damage.
  • You have proficiency with all armor, shields, simple weapons, and martial weapons.
  • You have proficiency in Strength and Constitution saving throws.
  • You can attack twice, instead of once, when you take the Attack action on your turn. You ignore this benefit if you already have a feature, like Extra Attack, that gives you extra attacks.
  • You can magically equip any item to which you are attuned as part of casting this spell. Weapons and shields appear in hand, and armor teleports onto your person.

components.m: A few hairs from a minotaur

spell.name: Mass Petrification
entries: You turn up to six creatures you can see within range into stone. If a target's body is made of flesh, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it is {@condition restrained} as its flesh begins to harden. On a successful save, the creature isn't affected.

A creature {@condition restrained} by this spell must make another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If it successfully saves against this spell three times, the spell ends. If it fails its saves three times, it is turned to stone and subjected to the {@condition petrified} condition for the duration. The successes and failures don't need to be consecutive; keep track of both until the target collects three of a kind.
If the creature is physically broken while {@condition petrified}, it suffers from similar deformities if it reverts to its original state.
If you maintain your {@status concentration} on this spell for the entire duration, the creature is turned to stone until the effect is removed.

components.m: An ounce of basilisk blood

spell.name: Mordenkainen's Disjunction
entries: When you cast this spell, you permanently sever the connections to the Weave within a 40-foot-radius sphere within range, with the following effects:
Spells of 8th level or lower of your choice within the area end.

Magic items of your choice become permanently non-magical. If you target an item with a rarity of "Very Rare" or lower, it ceases to be magical. If you target an item of "Legendary" rarity, you must succeed on a DC 25 Arcana check to render it nonmagical. You cannot render artifacts or creatures with the Construct type nonmagical with this spell. Sentient items can make a Charisma save against your Spell Save DC to retain their magical properties.
Spellcasters of your choice within range lose {@dice 1d6} levels worth of spell slots.
This spell overcomes the effects of an {@spell antimagic field} or similar effect.

spell.name: Nailed to the Sky
entries: When you cast this spell, choose a target within range that is a creature or object weighing less than 25,000 lbs. The target must make a Charisma saving throw or be teleported far into the sky. This spell actually places the target so far above the ground that it keeps missing the surface as it falls back, entering an eternal orbit (about 100 miles). Unless the target can magically fly or teleport, the target is stuck. Because the target is beyond the atmosphere, physical means of flight do not function, but even magical flight will put the target several hours away if descending safely.

A target immediately begins suffocating when they are transported by this spell, as all the air is ripped from their lungs by the pressure differential. While in this vacuum, the target is immune to thunder damage, but is {@condition deafened} and cannot cast spells with verbal components. The target begins taking {@damage 3d6} cold damage each turn.

If the target begins making the descent, they can reach an area with breathable air with 1 hour of travel on most planets. If they travel 1 hour towards the planet, then choose to fall the rest of the way, they will begin taking {@dice 3d6} points of fire damage per minute as they burn up from the friction of the atmosphere rushing past them. On Toril, Oerth, and similar-sized planets, it takes about one-and-a-half hours to fall to the surface. A target that survives re-entry to land takes {@damage 20d6} bludgeoning damage from the fall.

components.m: A mithral nail

spell.name: Transmute Stone to Lava
entries: As you release the spell's energy, stone of your choosing within a 20-foot cube instantly turns to molten lava, and the uncomfortable burning in your chest immediately ceases. You transform stone within the area of this spell into an equal volume of red-hot molten lava. Magical or enchanted stone is not affected by this spell.

A huge or smaller creature standing on a stone surface that is transmuted into lava sinks into it, causing them to become {@condition restrained} until they succeed on a Strength saving throw to escape. A creature that enters the lava on their turn or begins their turn there must make a Strength saving throw or sink into it. A large or smaller creature that sinks into the lava begins suffocating.

Creatures standing under a stone ceiling that is transmuted into lava take {@damage 10d6} bludgeoning damage from the falling lava, or half that on a successful Dexterity saving throw. The lava pools out to fill an area to a 3-foot depth in a 40-foot radius. This area becomes difficult terrain.

Coming into brief contact with lava created by this spell, such as from pooling lava entering a creature's space or the ground beneath it turning into lava, immediately inflicts {@dice 5d6} points of fire damage. The molten stone is hot enough that creatures and objects within 10 feet of it take {@dice 2d6} points of fire damage, or half that on a successful Dexterity saving throw, and all combustibles immediately ignite. When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it takes {@dice 10d6} points of fire damage, or half that on a successful Dexterity saving throw. A creature that takes any damage from the lava created by this spell has clinging, molten stone adhering to their person and takes an addition {@damage 2d6} fire damage for one turn after they leave the lava.

The lava cools naturally from its surface toward its center, and it no longer deals fire damage after {@dice 2d6} hours as it slowly reverts to stone. Though a 40-foot-radius pool can take as long as five days to completely cool, the core of a 10-foot cube of lava might remain molten for a month or more.

If you cast this spell on a creature mostly made of stone, such as a {@creature stone golem}, {@creature gargoyle}, or {@creature earth elemental}, that creature takes {@dice 20d6} points of fire damage and is affected as if by the {@spell slow} spell. On a successful Constitution saving throw, the creature takes half damage and is not slowed.

components.m: Brimstone, sulfur, and a pinch of smokepowder

spell.name: Everlasting Rime
entries: This spell must be cast at night. When you do so, the surrounding 100 miles are laid under your spell. The temperature in this region rapidly drops to arctic conditions, killing off vegetation and endangering unprotected creatures. For the next day, the sun fails to rise in this region, blocked out by a magical firmament. A bright aurora scintillates across the sky, providing Bright Light outside for the duration of the spell.
While this spell is active, you can use a bonus action on your turn to cause one of the following effects within an outdoors environment in the spell's area:

Faerie Frost. A 50 foot radius area within the spell is glazed with a sparkling, icy coating. Creatures in this area must make a Dexterity saving throw or also be coated. Until your next turn, any attack roll against an affected creature or object has advantage if the attacker can see it, and the affected creature or object can't benefit from being {@condition invisible}.

Razor Sleet. Gale force winds sweep through the area, assailing creatures with razor sharp ice and pushing them. A line of strong wind 60 feet long and 10 feet wide appears within the spells area. Creatures within the line of wind must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from you in a direction following the line, and take {@dice 4d10} slashing and {@damage 4d10} cold damage. A creature that makes their save is not moved, and takes half damage.

Rimefire. Sheets of energized light cascade from the auroras, sweeping across an area and destroying that which it touches. A wall of radiant energy 5 feet wide, 100 feet long, and 100 feet tall appears within the area of the spell. The wall blocks line of sight, but not movement. A creature that ends its turn in the wall's area takes {@damage 8d8} radiant damage, or half as much damage on a successful Constitution saving throw. A shapechanger makes its saving throw with disadvantage. If it fails, it also instantly reverts to its original form and can't assume a different form until it leaves the spell's light.

At the beginning of your next turn, the wall of radiant energy moves up to 500 feet in a direction of your choice. Anything it touches during this movement is affected as though it had ended its turn in the wall's area.

spell.name: Dominion
entries: You twist the mind of the target creature until it is well and truly yours. Even creatures without minds as they are conventionally known- constructs, plants, oozes, and so on- have desires or programming that can be subverted. A creature you can see within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw. If you or creatures that are friendly to you are fighting it, it has advantage on the saving throw.

On a failure, the creature's mind (or the relevant analogue) is re-written such that it lives to serve you. You have form a telepathic link with it that transcends even planar barriers. You can use this telepathic link to issue commands to the creature while you are conscious (no action required), which it does its best to obey. You can specify a simple and general course of action, such as "Attack that creature," "Run over there," or "Fetch that object." If the creature completes the order and doesn't receive further direction from you, it defends and preserves itself to the best of its ability.

You can use your action to take total and precise control of the target. When you do so, you perceive the world as though you were in the creature's space, using its senses. Until the end of your next turn, the creature takes only the actions you choose, and doesn't do anything that you don't allow it to do. During this time, you can also cause the creature to use a reaction, but this requires you to use your own reaction as well.

The changes wrought by this spell are permanent, and nothing short of a {@spell wish} spell can reverse the effects. If you die, any creatures you have cast this spell on will attempt to resurrect you by any means necessary.

spell.name: Comet
entries: You cause a comet to fall from the sky and crash to the ground at a point you can see up to 1 mile away from you. You must be outdoors when you cast the spell, or nothing happens and the spell is wasted.

The comet creates a 50-foot-deep, 500-foot-radius crater on impact. Any creature in that radius must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 50d10} force damage on a failed saving throw, or half as much damage on a successful one. All structures in the crater are destroyed, as are all nonmagical objects that aren't being worn or held.  This area becomes difficult terrain until repaired.

m.text: A shard of a fallen star, worth at least 1,000 gp

spell.name: Ashes to Ashes
entries: You summon a pillar of divine flame to smite a location you specify. Each creature in a 100-foot radius, 1,000-foot-high cylinder centered on a point you can see within range must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 25d6} fire damage and {@damage 25d6} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Creatures slain by this spell cannot be resurrected by magic short of a {@spell true resurrection} spell.

components.m: 1 pound of sulfur

spell.name: Animus
entries: You can cast this spell only at night. Choose any number of corpses within range. Each corpse becomes an undead creature under your control. The type of undead creature must be appropriate to the form of the corpse and have a CR of 5 or less.

As a bonus action on each of your turns, you can mentally command any creature you animated with this spell if the creature is within 1 mile of you (if you control multiple creatures, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one). You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the creature only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete.

m.text: A cauldron filled with water from the River Styx, and 10,000 gp of black onyx, which is consumed when the spell is cast.

spell.name: A Moment, Shackled
entries: You briefly stop the flow of time for everyone but yourself and up to 6 creatures of your choice that you can see within 100 feet. No time passes for other creatures, while {@dice 1d4 + 1} turns pass for the creatures caught up in your spell, during which they can use actions and move as normal.

Creatures caught up in the spell are unable to affect those outside of the spell; attacks bounce off of creatures as though they were statues of adamantine and spells merely fail. A creature under the effect of the spell may not move more than 1000 feet from where they were when the spell was cast. Creatures in the effect of the spell are perfectly able to affect each other, however.

spell.name: Fey Mien
entries: When you cast this spell, you channel the enchanting power of the feywild through yourself. All creatures within 60 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by you. If you or creatures that are friendly to you are fighting it, a target has advantage on the saving throw.
Creatures that would otherwise be immune to the {@condition charmed} condition instead make their saving throw with advantage.

A target can attempt the saving throw again if it spends more than 1 hour outside the aura of your spell, or if it takes damage. If the saving throw succeeds, it is immune to the effects of your casting of the spell for 24 hours.

spell.name: Fission
entries: You cause a miniature atomic fission reaction at a point you designate within range. Creatures and objects within 100 feet of the point you designate must make a Constitution saving throw or be disintegrated.
Creatures within 500 feet of the point you designate take {@damage 100d6} fire damage, or half as much on a successful Dexterity saving throw.

When creatures start their turn within 1,000 feet of the point you designate or move into that area for the first time on their turn, they take {@damage 10d10} radiant damage, suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion}, and begin emitting a dim, greenish light in a 5-foot radius. On a successful Constitution saving throw, they take half damage and do not gain a level of {@condition exhaustion} or begin glowing. This light makes it impossible for the creature to benefit from being {@condition invisible}. The light goes away when the spell ends.

components.m: 1 pound of lead

spell.name: Karsus' Avatar
entries: When you cast this spell, you select one deity. You siphon off that deity's divine energy, weakening them while imparting their divine essence into you. When you do so, the target deity's portfolio becomes unmanaged and all associated phenomena disappear or malfunction. You gain a Divine Rank of 1, unless yours was already higher, with all of its associated benefits. The target deity's Divine Rank is reduced to 1, unless it was already lower.
The target deity immediately becomes aware of who you are, what you just did, and where you are.

If you are not a god (i.e. you do not have a Divine Rank) and you cast this spell, the divine essence you absorb overwhelms you during your transformation. You immediately take 5 levels of {@condition exhaustion} and expend half of your hit dice. Although you gain dominion over the stolen portfolio of the target deity, you are probably not proficient in utilizing divine powers (performing miracles, granting spells, establishing a divine realm, and the like), thus may face difficulty in exercising them until you gain proficiency.

m.text: A gold dragon's gizzard, 1 gallon of tarrasque blood, bile from a 12-headed hydra, a diamond worth at least 100,000 gp,  and the remains of a dead god; all are consumed by the spell

spell.name: Khelben's Dweomerdoom
entries: This spell disrupts the flow of the Weave to the target creature. Choose one creature within 60 feet. While you are {@status concentration||concentrating} on this spell, each time the creature attempts to cast a spell of 5th level or lower, it fails. Each time the creature attempts to cast a spell of a higher level, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the creature's spell fails and has no effect; the slot is expended as normal.

Additionally, if the creature is under the effects of a spell or would come under the effects of a spell while you are {@status concentration||concentrating} on this spell, that spell fails to take effect if it is of 5th level or lower. If it is of a higher level, make an ability check as described above.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 11th level or higher, spells of 8th level or lower are dispelled or automatically counterspelled.

m.text: A crystal lens worth at least 15,000 gp

spell.name: Mass Raise Dead
entries: You return to life several dead creatures, provided they have been dead no longer than 10 days and are within 1 mile of you. If the creature's soul is both willing and at liberty to rejoin the body, the creature returns to life with 1 hit point.

This spell also neutralizes any poisons and cures nonmagical diseases that affected the creature at the time it died. This spell doesn't, however, remove magical diseases, curses, or similar effects; if these aren't first removed prior to casting the spell, they take effect when the creature returns to life. The spell can't return an undead creature to life.

This spell closes all mortal wounds, but it doesn't restore missing body parts. If the creature is lacking body parts or organs integral for its survivalâ€”its head, for instanceâ€”the spell fails to affect that creature.

Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. A target takes a âˆ’4 penalty to all attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks. Every time a target finishes a long rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it disappears.
This spell is taxing to cast, and you gain 2 levels of Exhaustion upon doing so.

Casting this spell greatly upsets those who guard the barriers between life and death, who call a Wild Hunt upon the caster. At some point within the next year, at the DM's discretion, a number of {@creature Avatars of Death} (see the stat block in the Deck of Many Things entry) or similar undead creatures equal to the number of creatures resurrected by this spell show up in force to seek the caster's death. If the caster is slain in this encounter, they can't be restored to life.

m.text: A collection of diamonds worth at least 500,000 gp, which the spell consumes.

spell.name: Omniscience
entries: You are utterly aware of everything within 120 feet of yourself. You have the benefits of true sight and blindsight out to this distance, and creatures cannot hide from you by any means. You have advantage on all attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws if they occur wholly within range. Attack rolls or opposed skill checks against you have disadvantage.
You can, as a bonus action, read the minds of any or all creatures within range of the spell, as per the {@spell detect thoughts} spell.
You can ask the GM questions about anything within range a receive a truthful answer, however the information you receive only reflects the present, not the future or the past.

spell.name: Proctiv's Move Mountain
entries: You choose a mountain or other earthen projection within range and shear the top off of it. The top then inverts, hovering over the ground at a distance of 300 feet. The {@item mythallar} used as a component in casting this spell controls the movement of the inverted mountaintop. A creature attuned to this {@item mythallar} can use an action to cause it to fly in any direction it chooses at a speed of 30 feet.

m.text: A crystall ball and a flying carpet, which are consumed in the casting of this spell, and a mythallar, which is not.

spell.name: Prophecy
entries: You gain the ultimate ability to shape the strands of fate. While this spell is active, any time a creature within 60 feet of you rolls a die, you can choose the face value of that die roll. Once you have used this ability, the spell ends.

This spell requires one of your eyeballs as a spell component. The organ must be an original part of your body (magic items such as an {@item ersatz eye} or the {@item eye of Vecna} which replicate the function of the eye do not count), however, an eye that is replaced via the {@spell regenerate} spell or similar magic can be used.

components.m: One of your eyeballs, which is consumed in the casting of this spell.

spell.name: Silver Flame of Mystra
entries: With the casting of this spell, you ignite the Weave flowing through a creature you can see within 60 feet. That creature must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the creature loses the highest level spell slot they have and takes {@dice 2d6} points of force damage per level of that spell slot. On a successful save, they take half that amount of damage. At the beginning of their next turn, the creature loses their next highest level spell slot and takes {@damage 2d6} force damage, or half that on a successful saving throw.
This spell continues until the creature runs out of spell slots, the creature dies, or after 1 minute.

m.text: A holy symbol of Mystra worth at least 5,000 gp.

spell.name: Summon Tarrasque
entries: You call forth the {@creature tarrasque}, which appears in an unoccupied space you can see within 1 mile. The {@creature tarrasque} disappears when it drops to 0 hit points, and is hostile toward all creatures other than itself.

m.text: A totem dedicated to the tarrasque worth at least 5,000 gp, consumed when the spell is cast

spell.name: The Flood
entries: A wall of water springs into existence at a point you choose within line of sight. You can make the wall up to 1 mile long, 1,000 feet high, and 100 feet thick. The wall lasts for the duration.

When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 20d10} bludgeoning damage, or half as much damage on a successful save.

At the start of each of your turns after the wall appears, the wall, along with any creatures in it, moves 50 feet away from you. Any Gargantuan or smaller creature inside the wall or whose space the wall enters when it moves must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take {@damage 10d10} bludgeoning damage. A creature can take this damage only once per round. At the end of the turn, the wall's height is reduced by 50 feet. When the wall reaches 0 feet in height, the spell ends.

A creature caught in the wall can move by swimming. Because of the force of the wave, though, the creature must make a successful Strength (Athletics) check against your spell save DC in order to move at all. If it fails the check, it can't move. A creature that moves out of the area falls to the ground.
The water summoned by this spell remains. When you cast this spell, choose if the water is freshwater or saltwater.
Because of the scale and damage of this spell, most structures and vegetation within the area will be washed away. Many terrain features will also be damaged by this amount of water.

spell.name: Valdick's Relocation
entries: You designate an area that fits within a 1,000-foot cube in range and transport everything within that area to a destination known to you that can support its weight or is of a similar material (for example, a teleported castle must arrive on solid ground, while a teleported body of water can arrive in contact with another body of water). Creatures that are unwilling may make a Charisma saving throw to avoid be transported (though if they avoid it, they might take fall damage as displaced terrain disappears beneath them). Buildings or terrain features partially within the area are only partially transported, with the effects on their structural integrity as determined by the DM.
Your familiarity with the destination determines whether the target area arrives their successfully. Roll on the table presented in Teleport to determine how on target the area is when it arrives.

You can transport an area to a different plane of existence if you have a tuning fork attuned to that plane (see the {@spell plane shift} spell). If you move the area to a different plane of existence, halve the value you roll on the Teleportation table.

If the destination is unoccupied, then the area arrives in the same condition as it left. If the destination is an occupied location, then the arriving area merges and overlaps with the existing area. All creatures and objects within the arrival area take {@damage 3d10} force damage as they are scrambled. The DM determines what the final form of the overlapped areas is.

m.text: a small globe carved from gemstone, worth at least 25,000 gp.

spell.name: Vorpal Smite
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack before this spell ends, your weapon surges with destructive energy. That creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature dies and is disintegrated. On a successful saving throw, it takes an extra {@dice 30d8} points of force damage and is Stunned until the end of its next turn. A creature slain by this damage is also disintegrated. A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a {@spell wish} spell.

spell.name: Weft
entries: You create a local replacement for the Weave, allowing you to subvert effects that would disrupt your spellcasting.

While {@status concentration||concentrating} on this spell, spells you cast cannot be interfered with by conventional magics, such as the spells {@spell antimagic field} or {@spell counterspell}. Additionally, spells you cast are never affected by Wild Magic while this spell is active.

spell.name: Nosirrag's Cartograph
entries: When you cast this spell, a pulse of {@condition invisible} energy sweeps out from you. The spell imparts magical knowledge of your surroundings, revealing to you the layout of structures within a 500-foot-radius. This spell cannot detect creatures, only large architectural elements, such as walls and doors. This spell only reveals information about areas at the same relative elevation or depth as you. This spell cannot penetrate thin sheets of lead or a {@spell magic circle} spell, which will appear as holes in the mental map this spell constructs for you.

components.m: A compass, an ear horn, and a tuning fork of mithral worth 100 gp.

item.name: Amulet of Form Stability
entries: While attuned to this magical amulet, you are immune to the {@condition petrified} condition and spells that would change your form, such as the {@spell polymorph} spell. Features that would change your form, such as a druid's Wild Shape feature, or the racial traits of a changeling or shifter, are suppressed while attuned to this amulet.

item.name: Amulet of Shopping
entries: This golden amulet is inscribed with the words: 'Sorcerous Sundries. Sellers to Heroes, Monarchs, Gods'. The words swim to become written in the native language of whoever reads them.

Shopping Trip. By focusing on this amulet as an action and saying the command word ('Cha-ching'), you are magically transported to the lounge of Sorcerous Sundries. Up to ten creatures, linked by their hands, can accompany you. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until after 5 days has passed.

item.name: Astral Sextant
entries: A creature that spends at least 10 minutes adjusting this device to a willing creature's thoughts can enter their dreams whenever both creatures are asleep. The guest dreamer is affected by {@spell dream} spells and similar magic as though they were the host dreamer.

item.name: Bag of Bones
entries: This ordinary bag, made from gray cloth, appears empty. Reaching inside the bag, however, reveals the presence of many bones.

You can use an action to pull a bone from the bag and throw it up to 20 feet. When the object lands, it transforms into a creature you determine by rolling a d6 and consulting the table. The creature vanishes at the next dawn or when it is reduced to 0 hit points.

The creature is friendly to you and your companions, and it acts on your turn. You can use a bonus action to command how the creature moves and what action it takes on its next turn, or to give it general orders, such as to attack your enemies. In the absence of such orders, the creature acts in a fashion appropriate to its nature.
Once three bones have been pulled from the bag, the bag can't be used again until the next dawn.

d6Creature
1d3 {@creature Skeleton}s
2d3 {@creature Zombie}s
3{@creature Ghoul}
4{@creature Specter}
5{@creature Ogre Zombie}
6d3 {@creature Shadow}s

item.name: Bag of Endless Caltrops
entries: A {@item bag of endless caltrops} magically produces normal caltrops. As an action, you can spread caltrops to cover a 5-foot-square area. Any creature that enters the area must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or stop moving and take 1 piercing damage. Until the creature regains at least 1 hit point, its walking speed is reduced by 10 feet. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the saving throw. After 24 hours, these caltrops disappear.

A {@item bag of endless caltrops} has 10 charges. Producing enough caltrops to cover a 5-foot-square area utilizes 1 charge. When you complete a long rest, the {@item bag of endless caltrops} regains {@dice 1d10} charges.

item.name: Bag of Endless Caltrops +1
entries: A {@item bag of endless caltrops +1} magically produces normal caltrops. As an action, you can spread caltrops to cover a 5-foot-square area. Any creature that enters the area must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw or stop moving and take {@dice 1d4+1} piercing damage. Until the creature regains at least 1 hit point, its walking speed is reduced by 10 feet. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the saving throw. After 24 hours, these caltrops disappear.

A {@item bag of endless caltrops +1} has 10 charges. Producing enough caltrops to cover a 5-foot-square area utilizes 1 charge. When you complete a long rest, the {@item bag of endless caltrops +1} regains {@dice 1d10} charges.

item.name: Ballista Bowstring
entries: You can use this magical, metallic bowstring to string a bow or crossbow. When you do so, you can use its magic to impel a piece of ammunition with great force.

Ballista Shot. As an action, you can make a special ranged weapon attack. Instead of choosing a single target, you make an attack against all targets in a 100 foot line projecting from you. You cannot make a Ballista Shot with a piece of ammunition that has special properties beyond a bonus to attack and damage rolls, or being made of a special material. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you complete a long rest.

item.name: Bastion Helm
entries: This magical greathelm has a row of decorative steel crenellations around the top. While wearing this helm, you gain the benefits listed below. If you move or are moved from your position (including via teleporation), you lose these benefits until the start of your next turn.
You have advantage on saving throws against effects that would move you against your will.
You are immune to the Grappled, Paralyzed, and Restrained conditions.

item.name: Belt of Antipode
entries: While wearing this belt, you have immunity to cold damage but you are vulnerable to fire damage. If you have resistance or immunity to fire damage, that protection ceases to function while wearing this belt.

item.name: Belt of Hidden Pouches
entries: This item might be made of silk or soft leather, but itâ€™s always fairly wide and with a big buckle (usually brass or silver).

Hidden inside the belt are ten small pockets, each of which seems big enough to hold only a few coins. Each pocket actually functions as a small {@item bag of holding}. No object with any dimension exceeding 6 inches can be placed in a pocket. Anything placed inside a pocket is weightless. In addition, two secret pockets lie behind each visible one, for a total of thirty pockets in all. The hidden pockets can be accessed only through a command word. A {@spell true seeing} or {@spell legend lore} spell reveals the presence of the hidden pockets but not the command needed to open them (these pockets are not detected by an {@spell identify} spell). Even when a pocket is full, it never bulges, so a belt of hidden pouches stuffed with 150 pounds of items looks like an ordinary belt.
Accessing a regular pocket uses your object interaction on your turn, while accessing a hidden pocket is a bonus action.

Simply frisking the wearer wonâ€™t reveal any objects placed in the belt, and searching the visible pockets cannot reveal anything stored in the hidden pockets. It is possible to pickpocket something out of one of the ten visible pockets, but only someone wearing or holding the belt can access the hidden pockets, and then only with the correct command word.

item.name: Belt of the Bear Tribe
entries: Your Constitution score is 16 while you wear this belt. It has no effect on you if your Constitution is already 16 or higher without it.
Savage Critical: When you critically hit with a melee weapon attack, you can add an additional weapon damage dice when determining the extra damage for a critical hit with a melee attack

item.name: Big Fisted Belt
entries: Your Strength score is 22 while you wear this belt. It has no effect on you if your Strength is already 22 or higher without it.
Additionally, your unarmed strikes inflict 1d6 bludgeoning damage while wearing this belt.

Big, Stupid Fingers. You cannot remove your attunement to this cursed item unless subjected to a {@spell remove curse} spell. Your Dexterity score is 6 while you are attuned this belt. It has no effect on you if your Dexterity is already 6 or lower without it.

item.name: Bootleg Spell Scroll
entries: These spell scrolls are waterlogged, made with discount materials, or otherwise not suitable for serious practitioners. They function as a normal spell scroll of its level, except that you cannot copy it into a spell book, and whenever you cast it, you must also roll on the {@table scroll mishaps} table.

item.name: Blindeye Amulet
entries: While wearing this amulet, you are hidden from divination magic. When you are targeted by such magic or perceived through magical scrying sensors, the caster of that spell takes {@dice 10d6} psychic damage, or half that on a successful DC 18 Wisdom saving throw.

item.name: Blindfold of Darkness
entries: This black silk blindfold magically heightens your senses when worn. While using this item, you are {@condition blind}, but you gain Blindsense out to a range of 30 feet.

item.name: Boots of Grounding
entries: While wearing these boots, you have immunity to lightning damage. You lose this immunity if you are {@condition prone}, or if you are not standing on a solid surface (such as when flying or swimming).
When you have lost lightning immunity, you are instead vulnerable to lightning damage.

item.name: Boots of Lightning Speed
entries: While attuned to these boots, your speed is doubled, you gain a +2 bonus to AC, you have advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and you gain an additional action on each of your turns. That action can be used only to take the Attack (one weapon attack only), Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object action.

Cursed.These boots are cursed, and you cannot remove your attunement to this cursed item unless subjected to a {@spell remove curse} spell. While attuned, you are restless and cannot slow down. You cannot take a short or long rest while attuned to these boots.

item.name: Boots of the Mountain King
entries: While wearing these boots, you ignore the effects of difficult terrain and have advantage to resist effects that would move you against your will. Additionally, you can cast {@spell stoneskin} using these boots as an action. Once you do so, you canâ€™t do so again until you complete a long rest.

item.name: Boots of the Tiger
entries: These boots are lined with the fur of saber-tooth tigers and give their wearer the great cat's grace. Your Dexterity score is 19 while you wear these boots. They have no effect on you if your Dexterity is already 19 or higher without them.
Additionally, while you are not {@condition incapacitated}, you reduce the distance of any fall by 20 feet when calculating fall damage.

item.name: Bowstring of Gond
entries: When you string a shortbow, longbow, light crossbow, heavy crossbow, or hand crossbow with this magical bowstring, you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls with that weapon. This stacks with any existing bonus you may have from the weapon or ammunition.

item.name: Bracers of Binding
entries: These cursed bracers were designed to humanely hinder or prevent criminal acts while worn, such as for persons released on bail or who are on parole.
While attuned to this item, you cannot cast spells with somatic components, and you have disadvantage on all attack rolls.

A creature who is {@condition incapacitated} automatically attunes to this item if they wear them for at least 1 minute (if they are already attuned to their maximum number of items, a randomly chosen item has its attunement removed).
Cursed. You cannot remove your attunement to this cursed item unless subjected to a {@spell remove curse} spell

item.name: Bracers of Bugbear's Strength
entries: Your Strength score is 16 while you wear these gauntlets. They have no effect on you if your Strength is already 16 or higher without them.
Brute Strength: When you hit with a melee weapon attack, you can add an additional die of damage. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you complete a short rest.

item.name: Bracers of Defense +4
entries: While wearing these bracers, you gain a +4 bonus to AC if you are wearing no armor and using no shield.

item.name: Bracers of Perserverance
entries: When you roll a natural 1 on an attack roll, you gain the benefits of a {@spell bless} spell for 1 minute.

item.name: Canto I of the Winding Path
entries: The monk themselves in their seeking is the koan. Realization of this is the insight; the response to the koan. Subject and object â€“ this is two hands clapping. When the monk realizes that the koan is not merely an object of consciousness but is also theirself as the activity of seeking an answer to the koan, then subject and object are no longer separate and distinct... This is one hand clapping.

This scroll is part of a larger meditation on the discovery and realization of the virtuous self. If you spend 48 hours over a period of 6 days or fewer studying the scroll's contents and contemplating its maxims, you gain 1 Ki point. If you do not have abilities that use Ki points, you may spend 1 Ki point as a bonus action to take the Dodge, Disengage, or Dash action. You restore all expended Ki points when you complete a short rest.
When you finish reading this scroll, the magic empowering it is used up. Can a student 'use up' wisdom?

item.name: Canto II of the Winding Path
entries: n the silence of a single breath, the forest reveals its wisdom. Does the tree ponder its growth, or does it simply become? Seek not the answers in the whispers of the wind, for the true path lies in the stillness of your own heart. When you cease to seek, you find all that you have ever sought.

This scroll is part of a larger meditation on the discovery and realization of the virtuous self. If you spend 48 hours over a period of 6 days or fewer studying the scroll's contents and contemplating its maxims, you gain 1 Ki point. If you do not have abilities that use Ki points, you may spend 1 Ki point as a reaction to deflect or catch the missile when you are hit by a ranged weapon attack. When you do so, the damage you take from the attack is reduced by {@dice 1d10} + your Dexterity modifier + your monk level.
When you finish reading this scroll, the magic empowering it is used up. Can a student 'use up' wisdom?

item.name: Catspaw Boots
entries: While you are wearing these boots, you reduce any falling damage you take by 75 points. Additionally, you are never knocked {@condition prone} from falling, and have advantage on effects that would cause you to become {@condition prone}.

item.name: Changeling's Vest
entries: While attuned to this vest, you have advantage on saving throws against spells that would change your form. In addition, you can cast the {@spell alter self} spell at will without needing to concentrate on it.

item.name: Choker of Eloquence
entries: While attuned to this choker, you have advantage on Persuasion and Deception checks against audiences of more than one person.

item.name: Circlet of the Magister
item.reqAttune: by a creature than can cast 5th level spells
entries: While attuned to this magical circlet, you gain an additional spell slot for spell levels 1-5.

item.name: Circlet of the Summoner
entries: While attuned to this circlet, any creature you summon via magical means is affected by the {@spell bless} spell for the duration of its summons. Magical means includes all spells and magic items, as well as most class features.

item.name: Cloak of Dragomir
entries: This cloak was crafted and imbued with powerful undead magic by the necromancer Zulann Fass while she was in the employ of the warlord Dragomir. Dragomir had been turned to vampirism and, not wanting to leave his previous life behind, demanded that Zulann craft a magical garment that would allow him to travel in the light of the sun without being destroyed. While Zulann was successful, the cloak severely dampened many of the vampiric abilities that Dragomir had come to enjoy. For this inconvenience, she was drained of her lifeblood by Dragomir and left to die.

While attuned to this cloak, you have resistance to radiant damage and advantage on saving throws against light-based spells. You are vulnerable to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from weapons or attacks made solely of wood while attuned to this cloak (a club, but not a spear, for example).
Additionally, a creature with the Sunlight Sensitivity or Sunlight Hypersensitivity traits (such as a drow or a vampire) have those traits suppressed.
A {@creature vampire} that is attuned to this cloak cannot use its Shapechanger or Misty Escape abilities.

item.name: Cloak of Protection +2
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to AC and saving throws while you wear this cloak.

item.name: Cloak of Shelter
entries: This magical cloak can transmute into a four-person tent by uttering its command word, and return to its wearable state with another command word. Additionally, this cloak can be used to cast {@spell leomund's tiny hut}. Once you use this feature, it can't be used again until you complete a long rest.

item.name: Cloak of the Fox Tribe
entries: Itâ€™s unclear if this cloak is an artifact of an extinct Reghed Fox Tribe, or if it is merely a marketing ploy. Regardless, while wearing this fur cloak, you have the following benefits:

• You are resistant to cold damage
  • You add +{@dice 1d4} to Intelligence ability checks and saving throws
  • You are have advantage on saving throws to resist magical effects that would cause you to be {@condition paralyzed} or {@condition restrained}, and you have advantage on checks to escape being {@condition grappled}

item.name: Cloak of the Gargoyle
entries: This pale grey cloak has dark veins running through it as though it were carved of marble. Of course, it is just made of heavy cloth, but it does impart some durability to its wearer. While you're wearing it, any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.

Additionally, as a reaction, you can turn yourself into stone. When you are stone, you are {@condition petrified} until the end of your next turn. While {@condition petrified}, you have immunity to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons and you have resistance to all types of damage. Once you turn to stone in this way you can't do so again until you complete a short rest.

item.name: Cloak of the Lurien Watch
entries: While wearing this cloak, you have a +3 bonus to AC against attacks by humanoids and giants.

item.name: Cloak of the Sewers
entries: This less-than-fashionable cloak is made from rat fur. While wearing this cloak, you have the following benefits:

• Your AC increases by +1
  • You are immune to mundane diseases
  • As an action, you can command the cloak to transform you into a rat for up to 1 hour. The transformation otherwise functions as the {@spell polymorph} spell, but you can use a bonus action to revert to your normal form. Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you complete a long rest.

item.name: Coin of Eternal Rest
entries: You can place this surprisingly heavy lead coin in the mouth of a corpse, or over its eyes. If you do so, the coin's magic is expended and the corpse becomes warded.

The corpse cannot be raised as an undead creature, and the body and attending soul cannot be the target of a {@spell speak with dead} spell or similar magics. The body cannot be returned to life by a spell less powerful than {@spell true resurrection}.

item.name: Cowl of the Comet
entries: This magical cowl has six golden rings attached to it. As an action, you can remove any number of the rings to create a number of tiny meteors in your space, as per the {@spell melf's minute meteors} spell, equal to the number of rings removed.
{@dice 1d4} rings magically re-appear when you complete a long rest.

item.name: Crown of Lies
entries: Although it appears impressive at a distance, this crown is made from foolâ€™s gold and with set with gems made of glass. While wearing this crown, you are under the following effects:

• You are immune to magic that allows other creatures to read your thoughts, determine whether you are lying, know your alignment, or know your creature type.
  • Creatures can telepathically communicate with you only if you allow it.
  • You cannot gain any benefit from spells of the divination school.
  • You Wisdom score is reduced by 2.
  • You have advantage on Deception checks.
  • You can cast the {@spell disguise self} spell. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you complete a short rest.

Cursed. This item is cursed. Attuning to it curses you until you are targeted by a {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic. As long as you remain cursed, you cannot discard the item, which immediately teleports back into your possession.

item.name: Daoud's Wondrous Lantern
entries: This artifact is wrought from the finest yellow gold. Its beautifully crafted framework is set with huge, colored gemstone prisms in place of lenses. An unwavering, pure flame burns within. The faces are normally fitted with clear crystal lenses, but the colorful gem lenses can be slid down to create a variety of magical effects.

The flame of {@item Daoud's Wondrous Lantern} cannot be extinguished by any known means, other than by exhausting its supply of fuel. If this occurs, however, the lantern's last user is instantly slain. The lantern is fueled by crushed gemstones, contained in a small compartment at its base. The lantern can be refueled with 10,000 gp worth of crushed gemstones, which provide it with 100 charges. If used only to provide light, the lantern burns 1 charge per year. The use of the lantern's magical powers require additional charges, however, and thus burn fuel at a faster rate.

When open, the lantern provides bright light out to a distance of 60 feet, and dim light out to a distance of 120 feet. The various shutters of the lantern can be operated as an action. The shutters of each side of the lantern can be operated independently, allowing the user to choose the angle light is emitted in 90 degree segments. Based on which lenses are lowered, certain magical effects occur as described below. Unless described otherwise, each lens affects creatures within the lantern's area of bright light (60 feet). The wielder of the lantern is never effected by the lantern's magic.

• Closed. The lantern emits no light.
  • Crystal Lens (1 charge / year). This lens casts a white light that provides no immediate effect, but those touched by the light for at least 4 hours do not need food, drink, or sleep for the next day. Those who spend at least 8 hours in the lantern's glow regain 25 hit points and have the effects of any disease or poison suspended for 24 hours. Those who spend a consecutive week in the light of the lantern are cured of all diseases and have all poisons neutralized.
  • Ruby Lens (5 charges / round). This lens casts a red light that causes those touched by it to be affected as though they were targeted by a {@spell hold monster} spell.
  • Jacinth Lens (5 charges / round). This lens casts an orange light that causes those touched by it to burst into magical flames and take {@dice 10d6} fire damage, or half as much on a successful Dexterity saving throw.
  • Topaz Lens (5 charges / round). This lens casts a yellow light that causes those touched by it to crackle with lightning, taking {@dice 10d6} lightning damage, or half as much on a successful Constitution saving throw.
  • Emerald Lens (5 charges / round). This lens casts a green light that causes those touched by it to behave as though affected by a {@spell haste} spell for 1 minute.
  • Sapphire Lens (5 charges / round). This lens casts a blue light that causes those touched by it to become {@condition blinded} unless they succeed on a Wisdom saving throw.
  • Lapis Lazuli Lens (5 charges / round). This lens casts an indigo light that causes those touched by it to become {@condition frightened} unless they succeed on a Wisdom saving throw.
  • Amethyst Lens (5 charges / round). This lens casts a violet light that causes those touched by it to be affected as though they were targeted by an {@spell enemies abound} spell.
  • Multiple Lenses (30 charges / round). You can lower all the lenses of the lantern, causing creatures touched by the light to be affected as though they were targeted by a {@spell prismatic spray} spell.
  • Spinning Lantern (50 charges / minute). You can lower all of the lenses and spin the lantern, replicating the effects of the {@spell prismatic wall} spell's spherical option, centered on the lantern.
All Saving Throws for the lantern's magical effects are DC 23.
Daoud of Tusmit originally created ten colors of gem lenses for the lantern, but when adventurers found it among Iggwilvâ€™s treasures, three of the lenses were missing.

It is said that anyone who possesses the lantern will slowly grow more and more possessive of it, reaching the point of paranoia after the first year of possession. They will keep it hidden from others and become suspicious of anyone asking about it or touching it. Progressively, the owner will eventually believe others are trying to take the lantern from them and defend it with violence, if necessary.

item.name: Diadem of Pure Thought
entries: This fine silver headpiece has three amethysts mounted across the brow of the wearer, representing the item's three charges.
Whenever the wearer fails a Wisdom, Intelligence, or Charisma saving throw, they can roll again. Doing so consumes one of the items charges and causes a gem to disappear.
Once all three charges have been used, the item becomes a nonmagical silver circlet worth 50 gp.

item.name: Diplomatic Failsafe +1
entries: This magical ring is a concealed weapon made for diplomats, spies, socialites, and others who must appear to be unarmed but value their safety. You can cause a beam of energy to shoot out of the ring's gemstone as a ranged weapon attack, dealing {@dice 1d6} radiant damage to a target you successfully hit. You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls with this attack.
If you roll a natural 1 on your attack roll, the ring runs out of energy and cannot be used. It can be recharged as an action by a spellcaster holding the ring and expending a 3rd level spell slot.

This weapon appears nonmagical when examined under the effects of {@spell detect magic}, {@spell identify}, or similar spells. A {@spell legend lore} or {@spell true seeing} spell can discern this objects true nature.

item.name: Druid's Ring
entries: This ring of dented copper is unadorned and appears quite simple. While attuned to this ring, you are treated as though under the effects of a {@spell sanctuary} spell that only affects the behavior of creatures with the Beast type.

item.name: Dwarven Stompers
item.reqAttune: by a creature proficient with medium or heavy armor
entries: As a bonus action, you can stomp the ground while wearing these boots to cause a local tremor in a 10 foot radius surrounding you. Each creature other than you in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}.
Once you use this item, you can't use this ability again until you complete a short rest.

item.name: Elander's Gloves of Displacement
entries: As part of an Attack action with a melee attack or as part of casting a spell with the range of Touch, you can activate these gloves. The magic of these gloves folds space so that your attacks or spell affect a creature within 30 feet, rather than one within reach. If you use these gloves in conjunction with the Attack action, and you are wielding a weapon in your off hand, you may also attack a creature within 30 feet with your bonus action.
Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you complete a short rest.

item.name: Elfbane Girdle
entries: While wearing this belt you have resistance to piercing damage.

item.name: Equus Helm
entries: This plumed helmet allows you to expend a charge to {@action dash} as a bonus action.
You regain all expended charges when you complete a long rest.

item.name: Evermemory
entries: This magical ring doubles the number of 1st level spell slots you have while you are attuned to it.

item.name: Eversoaking Sponge
entries: An eversoaking sponge appears to be a normal sponge, until you place it in water. The sponge absorbs a seemingly endless amount of water, shunting it to the Elemental Plane of Water. When placed in a body of water, an eversoaking sponge absorbs 1,000 gallons of water per round (about the size of 10 bathtubs). An eversoaking sponge can absorb up to 500,000 gallons of water (about the size of an olympic swimming pool) in one day. If you squeeze an eversoaking sponge, it releases no more water than a normal sponge would. An eversoaking sponge can only absorb inanimate water, and not any other liquids.

item.name: Feyguard Tunic
entries: As a reaction when you are hit by an attack you are aware of, you may teleport 15 feet in a random direction and cause the attack to miss. You have no control over the distance you teleport, however the item will not deposit you inside solid material. The item does not prevent you from being teleported over perilous drops, into hazardous effects, or through walls. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a short rest.

{@dice 1d8}Direction
1North
2Northeast
3East
4Southeast
5South
6Southwest
7West
8Northwest

item.name: Figurine of Wondrous Power, Serpentine Owl
entries: A figurine of wondrous power is a statuette of a beast small enough to fit in a pocket. If you use an action to speak the command word and throw the figurine to a point on the ground within 60 feet of you, the figurine becomes a living creature. If the space where the creature would appear is occupied by other creatures or objects, or if there isn't enough space for the creature, the figurine doesn't become a creature.
The creature is friendly to you and your companions. It understands your languages and obeys your spoken commands. If you issue no commands, the creature defends itself but takes no other actions.

The creature exists for a duration specific to each figurine. At the end of the duration, the creature reverts to its figurine form. It reverts to a figurine early if it drops to 0 hit points or if you use an action to speak the command word again while touching it. When the creature becomes a figurine again, its property can't be used again until a certain amount of time has passed, as specified in the figurine's description.
Serpentine Owl.

This serpentine statuette of an owl can become a {@creature giant owl} for up to 8 hours. Once it has been used, it can't be used again until 2 days have passed. The owl can telepathically communicate with you at any range if you and it are on the same plane of existence.

item.name: Filcher's Friend
entries: While wearing this ring, you can use an action to magnetize your hand. All unattended metallic objects weighing 10 pounds or less within 15 feet of you are drawn to your hand.

item.name: Flame of Surtr
item.reqAttune: by a creature with resistance or immunity to fire damage
entries: This magical lantern has 10 charges and emits a cone of light 30 feet long when unshuttered. A creature who is touched by the light of this lantern takes 5 fire damage at the start of their turn or when they enter the light's area for the first time on their turn. While lit, the latern consumes 1 charge per hour.

As an action, the latern's user can dump 5 charges worth of fuel to create a cone of flame 60 feet long. Creatures caught in the flame take {@dice 10d6} fire damage or half that on a successful DC 16 Dexterity saving throw.
Refueling the lantern requires sanctified oils costing 750 gp.

item.name: Flameshroud Cloak
entries: This half-cloak bears a harlequin pattern of red, yellow, and orange, with gold embroidery. Whenever you are hit by a melee weapon attack, you can use your reaction to cause the cloak to become a whirling flame surrounding you. All creatures within 5 feet must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 5d6} fire damage, or half as much on a successful save. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you complete a long rest.

item.name: Instrument of the Bards, Flute of the Immaculate Breeze
entries: An instrument of the bards is an exquisite example of its kind, superior to an ordinary instrument in every way. A creature that attempts to play the instrument without being attuned to it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take {@dice 2d4} psychic damage.

You can use an action to play the instrument and cast one of its spells. Once the instrument has been used to cast a spell, it can't be used to cast that spell again until the next dawn. The spells use your spellcasting ability and spell save DC.

You can play the instrument while casting a spell that causes any of its targets to be {@condition charmed} on a failed saving throw, thereby imposing disadvantage on the save. This effect applies only if the spell has a somatic or a material component.
All instruments of the bards can be used to cast the following spells: {@spell fly}, {@spell invisibility}, {@spell levitate}, and {@spell protection from evil and good}.
In addition, the Flute of the Immaculate Breeze can be used to cast: {@spell levitate}, {@spell wind wall}, and {@spell gust of wind}.

If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus. Each type of musical instrument requires a separate proficiency.

item.name: Fractal Ring
entries: This ring appears to be made out of glass. When you are targeted by an attack you are aware of while wearing this ring, you can use your reaction to generate an illusory duplicate of yourself for 1 minute. Until the effect ends, the duplicate moves with you and mimic yours actions, shifting position so it's impossible to track which image is real. You can use your action to dismiss the illusory duplicate.

Each time a creature targets you with an attack during the effects's duration (including the attack that triggered the effect), roll a d20 to determine whether the attack instead targets your duplicate. On an 11 or higher, the attack targets the duplicate instead.

A duplicate's AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier. If an attack hits a duplicate, the duplicate is destroyed. A duplicate can be destroyed only by an attack that hits it. It ignores all other damage and effects. If the duplicate is destroyed the effect ends.
A creature is unaffected by this effect if it can't see, if it relies on senses other than sight, such as blindsight, or if it can perceive illusions as false, as with truesight.
This ring has 3 charges. Creating a duplicate uses one charge. The ring regains 1 charge when you complete a long rest.

item.name: Gauntlets of Crushing
entries: While wearing these heavy, leather gloves you have a +2 bonus on {@action grapple} attempts. On a turn you are inflicting the {@condition grappled} condition on a target, you can choose to inflict {@dice 1d6} plus your Strength modifier bludgeoning damage.

item.name: Gauntlets of the Grand Masters
entries: While attuned to these magical gauntlets, your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

item.name: Gentrus' Hand Mirror
entries: The town of Luskan has earned its reputation as a lawless and dangerous place. The rampant brigandry in the area means a great many stolen goods are funneled through Luskan's back rooms and inns. One of the town's residents, the halfling Gentrus, crafted this mirror to help him divine the true nature of items he wished to buy. After a close call with a wererat, Gentrus decided to leave Luskan for the safety of Icewind Dale, joining a caravan traveling north. The halfling died on the road during a bandit attack, but the caravan's survivors drove off the bandits.

Looking at an object's reflection in this mirror shows its aura. A user proficient in the {@skill Arcana} skill can use this mirror with the same effect as a {@spell detect magic} spell or an {@spell identify} spell, at will. If a user studies a particular area through the mirror for 10 minutes or more, they gain the effects of the {@spell see invisibility} spell for as long as they remain in the same room or general area.

item.name: Giant Hair Bowstring
entries: Woven from the back hair of a {@creature hill giant}, this noxious bowstring requires great strength to draw. A character with 15 Strength can use a bow or crossbow strung with this magical bowstring. When you hit a creature using a weapon with this modification using an attack that is a critical hit or an attack you have advantage on, that creature is pushed 5 feet directly away from you.

item.name: Girdle of Bluntness
entries: While wearing this thick leather sword belt, you have resistance to slashing damage from nonmagical weapons.

item.name: Girdle of Fortitude
entries: While wearing this belt, you can use a bonus action to give yourself 10 temporary hit points. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you complete a long rest.

item.name: Gloves of Gripping
entries: While wearing these gloves, you cannot drop an item or be disarmed of a weapon unless you intend to be. Furthermore, climbing does not take any additional movement.

item.name: Gloves of the Apprentice
entries: While you wear these magical gloves, you have advantage on Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration on spells.

item.name: Golden Gates
entries: These are two 6-inch diameter golden rings.

As an action, you can expend 1 charge from the rings to create two linked teleportation portals between the rings. Any creature or object entering one portal exits from the other as if the two portals were a single opening that connects their locations. Most creatures can reach an arm through the portal to manipulate something on the other side, but attempting to make an attack through the portal is at Disadvantage due to being displaced from your body, and the target receives the benefit of three-quarters cover (+5 AC).

The portals can remain linked even when moving, but the effect ends when the two portals move more than 1 mile apart. As a bonus action while holding one ring, you can close both portals (ending the effect). The portals otherwise last for 1 hour.
The rings have 4 charges, and regain 1d4 charges at dawn.

item.name: Gorgon Helm
entries: This heavy, metal helm allows you to project a 30-foot cone of petrifying gas as an action. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target begins to turn to stone and is restrained. The restrained target must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends on the target. On a failure, the target is petrified until freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.
Once this ability is used, it can't be used again until the next day.

item.name: Graverobber's Cloak
entries: This deceptively simple cloak protects its wearer from a swathe of common undead abilities. While wearing it, you gain the following benefits:

• You are resistant to necrotic damage.
  • Your hit point maximum cannot be reduced.
  • You have advantage on saving throws against effects that would {@condition paralyze} you.
  • You have advantage on saving throws to resist disease
  • If you are killed while wearing this cloak by an effect that would cause your body to rise from the dead as an Undead creature, your body instead remains dead.
  • Your Strength score cannot be reduced by the features of a {@creature Shadow} or similar undead creature, and you are immune to the {@spell ray of enfeeblement} spell.

item.name: Headband of Focus
entries: While attuned to this item, you have a +1 bonus on attack rolls.
Additionally, whenever you hit with an attack, you can choose for that attack to become a critical hit. Once you use this ability you can't do so again until you complete a long rest.

item.name: Headwrap of Wisdom
entries: Your Wisdom score is 19 while you wear this headwrap. It has no effect on you if your Wisdom is already 19 or higher without it.

item.name: Heward's Handy Helper
entries: This small silver statuette is impeccably polished, no matter what condition it is stored in. It depicts a well-dressed servant (determine species by rolling on the {@spell reincarnate} table) with an outheld hand bearing a platter. You can speak this item's command word to cast the {@spell unseen servant} spell. If you use this item again while an {@spell unseen servant} already exists, then the first one disappears.

item.name: Hlin's Arrowhead Pendant
entries: While wearing this magical pendant, you have a +1 bonus to Death saving throws.

item.name: Horn of Silence
entries: You can use an action to speak the horn's command word and then blow the horn, which vibrates intensely but issues no sound. The horn emits magical silence in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the cone must make a DC 15 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is silenced. While silenced, the creature is immune to thunder damage, is {@condition deafened}, and cannot make any noise. A creature so silenced cannot cast spells with a verbal component.
Once you use this item, you can't use it again until you complete a long rest.

item.name: Hydra Necklace
entries: While attuned to this item, you cannot be killed by beheading. If you are beheaded, either by mundane means or by a {@item vorpal sword} or similar weapon, you become {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened}. At the end of your next turn, your head grows back.

item.name: Infernal Ruby Pendant
entries: You can use this item to cast the {@spell friends} cantrip at will. You can destroy this item to cast {@spell dominate person} instead, at DC 18.

item.name: Inquisitor's Bracers
item.reqAttune: by a character with the Divine Smite class feature
entries: While attuned to these bracers, whenever you make a Divine Smite, roll d12s instead of d8s.

item.name: Jacinth of Inestimable Beauty
entries: This reddish gemstone is indescribably beautiful and exquisitely cut in dozens of facets that reflect the smallest light into a splendid display of radiant beams. When openly displayed in the presence of any light source, the stone doubles the effective radius of illumination. When held aloft, the {@item jacinth of inestimable beauty} makes the bearer appear impossibly beautiful. Those who behold the bearer must make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or be permanently {@condition blinded}.

The bearer of the jacinth can use an action to cause the gem to wrap them in such incredible aesthetic that those who behold them must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or drop to 0 hit points and begin dying. Once this ability is used, it can't be used again until the next day.

Cursed. When you attune to this item, you become utterly captivated by it. You cannot remove you attunement to this item unless targeted by a {@spell wish} spell. Additionally, you must spend an extra hour to complete a long rest. This extra hour can occur before, after, or surrounding your normal period of rest or sleep, but it must be spent gazing at the {@item jacinth of inestimable beauty}. While gazing in this manner, you are {@condition stunned}.

item.name: Kazgaroth's Choker
entries: This blue silk choker is bound by a simple bone clasp in the front that bears a sigil of unknown origin. While attuned to this choker, you can't be affected or detected by spells of 3rd level or lower.

Unwholesome Arcana. You cannot remove your attunement to this cursed item unless subjected to a {@spell remove curse} spell. For every level of spell averted by this item, you take 5 force damage that cannot be reduced by any means.

item.name: Kazgaroth's Ring
entries: This magical ring absorbs mystical energies around its wearer. Unfortunately, this also includes their life energies. While wearing this ring you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects, but you reduce your Constitution by 4 points. When you reduce your Constitution, your current and maximum hit points are reduced as well.
