Curse. This item is cursed. Attuning to it curses you until you are targeted by a {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic. As long as you remain cursed, you cannot discard the ring, which immediately teleports back into your finger or pocket.

item.name: Knave's Robe
entries: While you are wearing these robes, you have a base AC of 12 + your Dexterity modifier. Additionally, if you are hidden from a creature when you cast a spell on it, you can choose to deal force damage equal to your spellcasting modifier. If you have the Sneak Attack feature and you strike a creature with a spell attack, you can also deal Sneak Attack damage to one creature targeted by the spell.

item.name: Lantanese Auto-Minstrel
entries: This music box plays an inspiring tune when wound and triggered. To do so, you use a bonus action on your turn to choose one creature within 60 feet of you who can hear you. This creature can be you. That creature gains one Bardic Inspiration die, a {@dice d6}.

Once within the next 10 minutes, the creature can roll the die and add the number rolled to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw it makes. The creature can wait until after it rolls the d20 before deciding to use the Bardic Inspiration die, but must decide before the DM says whether the roll succeeds or fails. Once the Bardic Inspiration die is rolled, it is lost. A creature can have only one Bardic Inspiration die at a time.
Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you complete a long rest.

item.name: Looking Glass
entries: This artificial eye replaces a real one that was lost or removed. While the looking glass is embedded in your eye socket, it can't be removed by anyone other than you, and you can see through the tiny orb as though it were a normal eye.
When seeing through this eye, you have darkvision out to a range of 60 ft.

item.name: Magic Compass
entries: This magical compass is accompanied by a small pebble which the needle always points to. If the pebble is on a different plane, the needle spins indefinitely.

item.name: Necklace of Tongues
entries: This necklace is made from the mummified tongues of many different varieties of creatures. While wearing this necklace, you have the ability to understand any spoken language you hear. Moreover, when you speak, any creature that knows at least one language and can hear you understand what you says.

item.name: Nether Scroll of Ythryn
entries: Unlike most scrolls, a {@item Nether Scroll of Ythryn} is not a consumable magic item. It takes 30 days of concentrated studyâ€”at least 8 hours per dayâ€”to attempt to understand this scroll. After completing this study, you must make a DC 25 Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check. If this check fails, you take {@dice 16d10} psychic damage, and you can attempt the check again after another 30 days of concentrated study.
When you succeed on the check, you gain the following benefits:

• Your Intelligence score increases by 2, to a maximum of 22. Once you gain this benefit, you can't use this scroll to increase your Intelligence again.
  • You gain the potential to cast spells above 9th level.
  • You increase the number of magic items you can attune to by 1.

item.name: Nymph Cloak
entries: This gorgeous cloak is hemmed with peacock feathers. Your Charisma score is 19 while you wear this cloak. It has no effect on you if your Charisma is already 19 or higher without it.

Blinding Beauty. You can cause all humanoids within 30 feet who can see you to be blinded by supernatural beauty. They must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be blinded for 1 minute. They may attempt a new saving throw at the end of their turn. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you complete a long rest.

item.name: Otyugh Cloak
entries: This gruesome, magical otyugh pelt still holds some of its natural abilities. A single tendril bearing three eyes hangs from the back of the cloak's hood. While wearing the cloak, you can use an action to telepathically communicate with a creature you can see within 60 feet of you that can understand a language, sending either simple messages or images when you do. The receiving creature can't respond to these messages.

The tendril hanging from the hood is 3 feet long and offers some limited articulation. While wearing the cloak, you can use an action to mentally control the tendril enough to manipulate a simple object, such as open an unlocked door, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial. The tendril can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

In addition, you can raise or lower the cloak's hood using a bonus action. While the hood is lifted, you can use an action to close your eyes and see through the eyes of the tendril. You can control the tendril while looking through the eyes in this way. When you do, you have darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. You return to your normal senses when you reopen your eyes or lower the hood.

item.name: Portable Bridge
entries: This object appears to be a rolled up bridge constructed of rope and planks. If you set it on a solid surface in front of an unspanned gap and speak its command word, it magically affixes itself to the ground and extends up to a maximum of 50 feet to attach to the other side.
The bridge has AC 20 and 40 hit points. It regains 1 hit point every 5 minutes as long as it has at least 1 hit point. If the bridge drops to 0 hit points, it is destroyed.

item.name: Relair's Mistake
entries: A great amount of irony surrounds the creation of this magical cloak. Relair was a mage who overestimated the control he had over magic, and in the course of creating this garment he apparently inflicted lycanthropy upon himself. The wearer can change form whenever he wishes. Relair was not so lucky.

This cloak is lined with the fur of dire wolves. As an action, you can command the cloak to transform you into a {@creature Dire Wolf} for 1 hour. The transformation otherwise functions as the {@spell polymorph} spell, except you retain your mental ability scores.

Cursed. This item is cursed. Attuning to it curses you until you are targeted by a {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic. As long as you remain cursed, you cannot discard the item, which immediately returns to your possession.

Ill-Considered. This cloak includes no way to end its transformation early, unless you are reduced to 0 hit points. Furthermore, each time you transform using this cloak, roll a d20. On the roll of a 1, you contract the wolf strain of lycanthropy.

item.name: Ring of Clumsiness
entries: This ring appears to be a {@item ring of agility} when inspected or the target of an {@spell identify} spell. While attuned, it reduces your dexterity score to 6, unless it is already lower, and prevents you from casting spells with somatic components.

Cursed. This item is cursed. Attuning to it curses you until you are targeted by a {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic. As long as you remain cursed, you cannot discard the item, which immediately returns to your possession.

item.name: Ring of Agility
entries: You have a +2 bonus to Dexterity while wearing this ring, which can raise your agility no higher than 24. In addition, when you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

item.name: Ring of Borrowed Time
entries: Once per day, the bearer of this ring can re-roll any single die roll. When they do so, they magically age, according to the following chart.  If your ancestry is not listed below, work with the DM to choose or create an appropriate one.

AncestryAging
Human, Dragonborn, Half-Orc+{@dice 1d4} years
Half-elf, Halfling+{@dice 2d4} years
Dwarf, Gnome+{@dice 2d6} years
Elf+{@dice 2d10} years

item.name: Ring of Human Influence
entries: Your Charisma score is 18 while you wear this ring. It has no effect on you if your Charisma is already 18 or higher without it.
It does say 'human' inlfuenceâ€¦ You have disadvantage on Charisma checks to influence non-human creatures (including humanoids and non-humanoids).

item.name: Ring of Invisibility, Lesser
entries: You can use an action to cause the ring to become {@condition invisible} until you use another action to make it visible, until you remove the ring, or until you die.

item.name: Ring of Lockpicks
entries: With an uttered command word, this magical ring transmutes into a set of {@item thieves' tools}. With a second command word, you can turn it back into a ring for subtle storage and safekeeping.

item.name: Ring of Ten Towns
entries: While wearing this ring, you can stand on and move across any liquid surface as if it were solid ground.
Additionally, this ring has 5 charges. You can expend a charge to cast one of the spells below (Save DC 15). The ring regains all expended charges when you finish a long rest:

• {@spell frost fingers}
  • {@spell absorb elements} (cold damage only)
  • {@spell flame blade} (2 charges; deals cold damage instead of fire)

item.name: Ring of the Wall
entries: This tarnished silver ring has a brickwork pattern. While wearing this ring, you can cast {@spell enlarge/reduce} on yourself, choosing the enlarge option only. Once you do so, you can't do so again until you complete a long rest.

item.name: Robe of Arcane Aptitude
entries: While wearing this robe, your base AC becomes 14 + your Dexterity modifier. Additionally, you can store up to 2 levels of spells in it, as a {@item ring of spell storing}, which must be cast into it by a creature attuned to these robes.

item.name: Robe of Red Flames
entries: You have a base AC of 12 while wearing these robes, and you are resistant to fire damage. In addition, all damage rolls you make that inflict fire damage benefit from a +2 bonus to damage.

item.name: Robe of the Evoker
entries: These dark robes have a series of stripes of varied, but muted, colors around the cuffs and hem of the robe. Silver embroidery on the robe's back depicts a lightning bolt striking a tower.

While wearing this robe, your base AC becomes 14 + your Dexterity modifier. Additionally, you can cast {@spell absorb elements} using this item three times. If this use of {@spell absorb elements} reduces the damage you take by 15 or more points, you regain a 1st level spell slot, if you are capable of casting 1st level spells. You regain all uses of this item when you complete a long rest.

item.name: Robe of Very Useful Items
entries: This robe has cloth patches of various shapes and colors covering it. While wearing the robe. you can use an action to detach one of the patches, causing it to become the object or creature it represents. Once the last patch is removed, the robe becomes an ordinary garment.
The robe has two of each of the following patches:

• {@item +1 dagger}
  • {@item sending stones}
  • {@item magic compass}
  • {@item mystery key}
  • {@item tanglefoot bag}
  • {@item sovereign glue}
In addition, the robe has {@dice 4d4} other patches. The DM chooses the patches or determines them randomly.

{@dice 1d100}Patch
01-08Bag of 500 gp
09-15{@item Eversoaking Sponge}
16-22{@creature door mimc}, which is friendly to you
23-30{@item Spell Scroll}, 3rd level
31-44{@item Spell Scroll}, 4th level
45-51{@item Alchemy Jug}
52-59{@item Portable Bridge}
60-684 {@item potion of superior healing}
69-752 {@item greater memory potion}
76-83{@item Bag of Holding}
84-90{@item Broom of Flying}
91-96{@item Blindfold of Darkness}
97-00{@item Keg of Smokepowder}

item.name: Roranach's Horned Helm
entries: While wearing this helm, you can perform a special charge maneuver as an action. To do so you do so, you must move at least 20 feet in a straight line. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks and can pass through the areas of other creatures. Creatures you pass through take {@dice 2d6} bludgeoning damage must make a DC 16 Dexterity check or be knocked prone. At the end of your charge, you may make a single melee weapon attack against a creature within your reach. You make this attack with Advantage.
Once you use this helm, you can't do so again until you complete a short rest.

item.name: Screaming Bagpipes
entries: This horrid instrument is composed of fleshy tentacle-pipes, and the whole affair reeks of fish. A creature that attempts to play the instrument without being attuned to it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take {@dice 2d6} psychic damage.

You can use an action to play the instrument and cast one of its spells. Once the instrument has been used to cast a spell, it can't be used to cast that spell again until the next dawn. The spells use your spellcasting ability and spell save DC.

You can play the instrument while casting a spell that causes any of its targets to be {@condition frightened} on a failed saving throw, thereby imposing disadvantage on the save. This effect applies only if the spell has a somatic or a material component.
The {@item screaming bagpipes} can be used to cast the following spells:

• {@spell tasha's caustic brew}
  • {@spell shatter}
  • {@spell fear}
  • {@spell confusion}

item.name: Ship in a Bottle
entries: You can use an action to speak this item's command word and point it at a vehicle within 60 feet. That vehicle is shrunken down to miniature size and stored inside the bottle as long as the vehicle is less than 250 feet in all dimensions. Any occupants or crew of the vehicle when it is targeted can make a DC 13 Charisma saving throw. On a failed saving throw, they are trapped in the bottle with the vehicle. A creature trapped in the bottle doesn't need to breathe, eat, or drink and doesn't age.
You can use an action to remove the bottle's cork and release the vehicle the bottle contains into an unoccupied location adjacent to you.

item.name: Sidestep Slippers
entries: While wearing these fine silk slippers, you can move 15 feet as a reaction. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you complete a short rest.

item.name: Slickstep Boots
entries: These oil-stained boots render their wearer immune to the {@condition restrained} condition, as well the effects of difficult terrain. In addition, the wearer has advantage on saving throws to resist becoming {@condition grappled}, {@condition petrified}, or {@condition paralyzed}.

Cursed. This item is cursed. Attuning to it curses you until you are targeted by a {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic. As long as you remain cursed, you cannot discard the item, which immediately returns to your possession.

While cursed by these boots, every time you roll a 1 on an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you fall {@condition prone}. In addition, you fall {@condition prone} if you have moved more than 15 feet since the end of your last turn.

item.name: Stalker Gauntlets
entries: While wearing these gloves, you gain the Sneak Attack feature as though you were a 1st level rogue. If you already have the Sneak Attack feature, you increase your sneak attack damage by +1d6.

item.name: Standard of the Rumbling 5th
entries: This magical battle standard is emblazoned in white with a flaming skull over crossed, smoking pistols flew above the now-extinct Giff 'Rumbling 5th' rifle corps. While attuned to this standard is prominently displayed, allies within 30 feet of you are treated as being proficient on saving throws to resist effects that would render them {@condition frightened}.

Rally. You can use your action to wave the {@item Standard of the Rumbling 5th} and rally your allies. All friendly creatures within 30 feet that are {@condition frightened} cease to be {@condition frightened}. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you complete a long rest.

item.name: Steadfast Helm
entries: While wearing this helm, you are immune to the {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} conditions.

item.name: Steadfast Stone
entries: This solid stone cube is 3 inches to a side. When the surface is wet, it reveals magical Terran runes. As an action you can speak the stone's command word and cause it to expand to become a cube that is 10 ft to a side. You can speak another command word as an action to cause the cube to shrink back down to its hand held size.

If a creature is in the area the stone grows to occupy, it is pushed out by the shortest possible path unless it succeeds on a DC 20 Strength saving throw. If it cannot be pushed (because it is in a confined space for example), then it takes {@dice 8d10} bludgeoning damage. The cube has 100 hit points, immunity to damage from nonmagical weapons excluding siege weapons, and resistance to all other damage. Damage is not repaired when the cube changes size, but a casting of a {@spell stone shape} spell or similar magic can repair 25 hit points.

item.name: Sutra of Tranquil Thought
entries: This monastic tome describes ancient techniques of mental focus and is highly prized by psionic practitioners. If you study the work during one week of solitary contemplation you gain the following benefits:

• You gain your choice of the {@feat telekinetic} or {@feat telepathic} feats.
  • If you are a Psi Warrior {@class Fighter} or Soulknife {@class Rogue}, you gain 4 additional Psionic Energy dice.
  • If you are a Great Old One {@class Warlock}, you gain an additional Pact Magic spell slot.

item.name: Tablet of Retreat
entries: You can break this tablet as an action. When you do so, you cast your choice of {@spell plane shift} or {@spell teleport} targeting yourself only.

item.name: The Iron Thorn
entries: This ugly ring appears to be a twisted, rusty nail formed into a circle. While wearing this ring, you are warded against hostility from lesser undead creatures. Any creature of the Undead type with a CR of 5 or less who targets you with an attack or a harmful spell must first make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. You are not protected from area effects, such as the explosion of a {@spell fireball}.
If you make an attack or cast a spell that affects an Undead creature, or otherwise deal damage to one, it is no longer affected by the warding effect of this item.

Cursed. This item is cursed. Attuning to it curses you until you are targeted by a remove curse spell or similar magic. As long as you remain cursed, you cannot discard the ring, which immediately teleports back into your finger or pocket. While cursed by this ring, your Charisma score is reduced by 4. In addition, you are under an illusion that makes you appear undead.

item.name: Thieves' Tools +1
entries: This is an enchanted set of thieves' tools, made of brushed mithral to minimize their luster. You have a +1 bonus to ability checks made with these tools.

item.name: Third Eye Circlet
entries: This circlet bestows the effects of a {@spell see invisibility} spell upon its wearer.

item.name: Transposer Cloak
entries: This cloak is divided diagonally into two colors. The upper portion is pure white, while the lower is black as night. A transposer cloak allows you to switch positions with another creature. When you activate this cloak, you and any one creature within 30 feet swap positions. Both you and the target must occupy the same size of space on the battlefield (for instance, a human could swap places with a dwarf or a goblin, but not with an ogre or a cat). If the other creature is unwilling to trade positions, it is allowed a DC 15 Charisma save to negate the effect.
Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you complete a short rest.

item.name: Traveler's Robes
entries: This robe has been perfected for use by any rambling, itinerant mage that travels from town to town. Its enchantments provide protection from the bandit's arrow and from the jealous arcane trickster that lies in ambush with his {@spell stinking cloud}.

While attuned to these robes, your walking speed increases by 5 feet. Your base armor class while wearing these robes is set to 11 + your Dexterity modifier. Additionally, you can {@action disengage} as a bonus action on your turn.

Candlekeep Cha-Cha. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you complete a long rest.

item.name: Trollhide Cloak
entries: This ugly green-grey cloak is made of rubbery troll hide, and still has uneven patches of black hair growing over it. While wearing this cloak, your Constitution score increases by 2, to a maximum of 20. Conversely, your Charisma score decreases to 8 while wearing this cloak (unless it was already lower than 8), and you have disadvantage on Deception and Persuasion checks.

item.name: Venom Quiver
entries: Any ammo stored in here becomes poisonous, dealing 1d4 extra poison damage.
Cursed. On a hit roll of a natural 1 with ammunition that has been poisoned by this quiver, all ammunition within the quiver polymporphs, becoming a {@creature swarm of poisonous snakes}.

item.name: Weightless Scabbard
entries: This magical scabbard reduces the weight of any sword placed inside of it to 0 while that blade is sheathed. This scabbard has an internal extradimensional space, and can accommodate a blade of any length.

item.name: Whispering Earring
entries: This magical earring confers the ability to communicate with others who own similar items. Though often commissioned in matching sets, the owner of a whispering earring can bring theirs into resonance with another by tapping them together and speaking the item's command word. Multiple earrings can be brought into the same resonance, thus creating a web of whispering earrings.

After a whispering earring has been brought into resonance, the wearer can touch it and speak aloud, and all whispering earrings in the same resonance will repeat those words into the minds of their wearers. A whispering earring must be within 300 feet of another whispering earring in the same resonance to send or receive messages. Magical {@spell silence} and sheets of lead block communications to and from whispering earrings.

item.name: Widow's Veil
entries: This gauzy fabric is worn over the eyes and secured by a jeweled headband. While worn, you can use your gaze to afflict creatures within 30 feet with magical forms of suffering by expending charges. All saving throws are DC 15. The item has 5 charges, and regains 1d4 when you complete a long rest.

Rebuke the Fallen (1 charge). An undead target must make a Charisma saving throw or take {@dice 3d8} force damage and then be turned, as though by a {@class cleric}'s Turn Undead ability, for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. A creature with a CR of 1/2 or lower is instantly destroyed if it fails its save.

Crippling Pain (3 charges). The target must make a Constitution saving throw or be afflicted with crippling pain for 1 minute. While affected, any speed can be no higher than 10 feet, and a target concentrating on a spell loses concentration on it. The target may make a save at the end of their turn to end the effect.

Madness of Moil (5 charges). The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be afflicted by an altered mental state for 1 minute. The target may make a save at the end of their turn to end the effect. Roll on the following table to determine the targets behavior:

{@dice d3}Effect
1Weeping. Fat, oily tears well up in the target's eyes and they screw them shut. They are {@condition blinded} while the effect persists.
2Bitterness. The target is overcome by bitterness towards the nearest creature to them. While the effect persists, they will move towards them and make a single melee attack against them on their turn.
3Lamentation. The target sinks to their knees and begins wailing skyward about nothing in particular. They are {@condition prone} and {@condition incapacitated}.

item.name: Imyrith's Talon +2
entries: This magical scimitar is made from one of the talons of the great wyrm Imyrith. You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magical scimitar and deal an additional {@dice 1d6} lightning damage on a successful hit. In addition, you can use this scimitar to cast {@spell lightning bolt} (save DC 15) once per long rest.
